topic.title: The path from Markdown to DITA

body.p: We can use both * and - to signal a list item
If we already have a list a new item at the end will be added to the existing list
Ordered lists start with '1.' like below:
But the actual number after the first one is not really important:
You can also define a Markdown like code block
Links are also detected and converted to cross references, like this one:
See the [oXygen website](http://www.oxygenxml.com) for more details.
We can combine a link and a list
* See the [oXygen website](http://www.oxygenxml.com) for more details.
We can handle also `inline code` markup [oXygen website](http://www.oxygenxml.com).
Sections can be easily created by using ## to mark their title.
And so on... additional rules can be added to allow learning DITA from a Markdown perspective.
On the last paragraph you can use # to mark an inner or sibling topic title
